definitions: To enclose in a case or covering.
To inspect or study (a place, situation, or person) carefully, especially in preparation for a crime or other action.
To cover the outside of (a building) with a different material.
To put (a person) into a particular situation or condition.
examples: He will case the jewels in a velvet box.
The burglars cased the bank for weeks.
They decided to case the house with stone.
The new evidence might case him in a bad light.
